outcome: The above application has been filed by the petitioner under Section 482 of Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita (for short, BNSS), 2023 seeking anticipatory bail
full_text: 1 IN THE COURT OF THE SESSIONS JUDGE - VI, THIRUVANANTHAPURAM. Present : Sri. VISHNU K., ADDITIONAL SESSIONS JUDGE -VI Saturday, the 1 day of March, 2025 CRIMINAL M.C.No.533/2025 (Crime No.4/2025 of Excise Range Office, Kilimanoor) PETITIONER/IACCUSED : Dileep Kumar, aged 58 years, S/o.Vamadevan, Pooram Veedu, Poikakada, Koduvazhannoor, Chirayinkeezhu Taluk, Thiruvananthapuram District. By Adv.Anu.V.S RESPONDENTS/COUNTER PETITIONERS:- 1. The State of Kerala, represented by the Public Prosecutor, Thiruvananthapuram. 2. The Excise Inspector, Kilimanoor Excise Range. By Addl.Public Prosecutor A.R. Shaji This Cril.M.C having been finally heard on 27..02..2025 and the Court on 01..03..2025 passed the following : ORDER The above application has been filed by the petitioner under Section 482 of Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita (for short, BNSS), 2023 seeking anticipatory bail in connection with Crime No.04/2025 of Kilimanoor Excise Range, registered for the offence punishable under Section 55(i) of Kerala Abkrai Act | of 1077. 2.Petitioner is the accused in the above crime. 3. The prosecution allegation is that on 11/01/2025 at 04:55 pm, the accused was found in possession of 5 litres of Indian Made Foreign Liquor for the purpose of sale, in contravention of the provision of the Abkari Act. Thus, the accused is said to have committed the above offences. 4.Heard both sides. 5.The counsel appeared for the petitioner further submitted that the petitioner is 2 innocent and he is falsely implicated in the case. He has not committed any offence as alleged. 6.On the other hand, the learned Additional Public Prosecutor opposed the bail application. 7.It is seen from the report filed by the Investigating Officer that the contraband articles are taken into custody and produced before Court. Therefore, this court is of the view that the petitioner can be granted pre-arrest bail by imposing conditions. In the result, Criminal MC is allowed on the following conditions; (i). The petitioner shall make himself available for interrogation by the Investigating Officer as and when required. (ii). In the event of arrest, the petitioner shall be released on bail on his executing bond of Rs.50,000/- with two solvent sureties of like amount subject to the satisfaction of the arresting authority. (iii). The petitioner shall co-operate with the investigation and shall not to indulge in any activities detrimental to the same. (iv). The petitioner shall not, directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any police officer. Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, typewritten by her in the computer, corrected by me and pronounced in open Court on the 1 day of March, 2025. VISHNU K., ADDITIONAL SESSIONS JUDGE VI Typed by :Seena.L Bench ClerleSindhuG. JSISS: 3 ORDER IN CRIMINAL M.C.No.533/2025 DATED:01/03/2025 4 5
